Your portable power bank can be a lifesaver for your Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra smartphone as well. Most portable power banks can charge multiple devices, including smartphones, as long as they have the right ports and sufficient power capacity.

**Can your power bank charge your Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra?**

1. Check your power bank's output specifications:
	* Look for the output voltage and current rating, usually indicated in Volts (V) and Amperes (A).
	* The Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra supports fast charging at up to 25W (5V, 5A) or Quick Charge 2.0 (9V, 1.67A).
	* Ensure your power bank can provide at least 5V, 2A output to charge your phone efficiently.
2. Check the power bank's capacity:
	* Your power bank's capacity is measured in milliampere-hours (mAh).
	* A higher capacity (e.g., 20,000mAh) means you can charge your phone multiple times or charge larger devices.
	* A smaller capacity (e.g., 10,000mAh) might only charge your phone once or not at all.
3. Check the power bank's ports:
	* Ensure your power bank has a USB-A port (traditional rectangular port) or a USB-C port with a USB-C to USB-C cable.
	* If your power bank has multiple ports, you can charge your phone and watch simultaneously.

**Tips for charging your Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra with a portable power bank**

1. Use a high-quality USB-C to USB-C cable or a USB-A to USB-C cable to charge your phone.
2. Charge your phone when the battery level is between 20% and 80% full to prolong the battery's lifespan.
3. Avoid overcharging your phone, as this can affect the battery's health.
4. If your power bank supports fast charging, use a fast charging cable and enable fast charging on your phone.
5. Keep your power bank and phone in a cool, dry place while charging to prevent overheating.

If your portable power bank meets these requirements, you can use it to charge your Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra smartphone. Just connect your phone to the power bank using a compatible cable, and you're good to go!
